text: Boonweaver Karador plays pretty much exactly the same every turn outside of cEDH. It's been my experience that it's kind be of the go-to for folks who want to pretend they're playing cEDH but really want to pubstomp non-cEDH decks and then talk shit
:eyes: <@U28TLDP0R>
Lol
in my experience boonweaver karador is far less linear than other cedh decks
its pretty resilient and midrange feeling
it can combo off early but its strength is being resilient to things like boardwipes and coutermagic
plus hatebears help drag out the game to set up the win
If it's playing midrange it's not a boonweaver Karador deck :grinning:
I guess that's a bit no true Scotsman
It's not a competitive boonweaver ?
When I hear boonweaver Karador I think every possible tutor and a deck whose entire plan is boonweaver combo asap
Otherwise it's just a Karador deck that may have boonweaver
Yeah, me too
My mental definition my not be what everyone else pictires

I ran Karador for a bit pre-meren. It was fun the first few weeks just because it was such a busy deck as a valuetown build, but that also got kinda exhausting since it was super easy to do a ton of stuff and not necessarily accomplish much. Then meren got released and would up being mostly Karador without white, and that was the end for me.
I saw a Karador spirit tribal deck once that was kinda neat

My biggest memory of Karador was from when I first started playing EDH. I was a total noob. Sat down to a table with a guy who had just finished Karador. He got 1/3 of his deck in his gy and I got him with Rakdos Charm. Just because it seemed good. I don't think he was really the threat at the table even.
Poor kid. You could just see his face fall. And the confusion, like "um, okay, but... Why?"
Because he had stuff in there
Rakdos charm probably should be in any deck that can run it, it just does so much work
Definitely. Every now is relevant
Every mode
Yup - that is among the better charms, really.
Each mode is relevant. You get gy hate, artifact hate and punish go-wide folks.
Charms are so flexible, you're never sad to see them. naya charm is my pick for best charm
Hrm...that's debatable, but I think Rakdos's modes are all relevant in more situations in EDH vs. Naya.
Naya is fantastic, don't get me wrong, just on sheer power/relevancy I think Rakdos hits harder more often.
[[Rakdos Charm]], [[Naya Charm]]

text: It's great when those situations arise, but...

They're all good, Rakdos's most situational mode (deal 1 to it's owner) scales so damn well.
gy & artifact hate are just so necessary in our format.
I don't run enough rb-based decks to use it enough, but where I do it's there.
I do run Naya charm in Samut
An instant-speed Eternal Witness is no joke.
I use it in Kynaios and Tiro. Get back something I need, or if I feel like politicking, let someone else get back a removal spell to take care of a mutual threat
Rakdos is also nice since you can put it under [[Isochron Scepter]]...

I always thought it'd be super hilarious to see matt tabak or Toby Elliot to do one of those things with a casual player group and they just rules lawyer the shit out of them. Every time the casual player has their doubts and asks "are you sure that's how it works? That doesn't seem..."
"I made the rule..."
But you make so many rules...are you sure you remember this right?

shut up you
